WorkItem.Description:
Hello,

installing Adobe Reader 11 over Wsus works fine. but the Workstation ( xp sp3 ) has no
start menu entry nor a Desktop link to start Adobe Reader.
What is wrong?

Thank Alex
WorkItem.Summary: Adobe Reader 11 install - no start menu entry

Comments.Message: Did you modify the MSI? Did you use a MST with the Installation?

i have used the step by step guide from wsuspackagepublisher.codeplex.com:
Adobe Reader XI Deployment with Custom Settings (updated)

The Adobe Customizaition Wizzard Shows the Desktop link and the start menu in AcroRead.msi

[german]

Hallo,

ich bin nach der step-by-step Anleitung vorgegangen und auch der Customizaition Wizzard zeigt auch
die Desktop / Startmenü Einträge in der Datei AcroRead.msi an.

Viele Grüße
Alexander Fröhner

Hi, does this happen only on Win XP SP3 ?

In the customisation Wizard, select 'Shortcuts' in the left panel and look settings on the right panel. (See my attached screenshot)
Did you have installed on a W7 too? If yes, are there the Links available?
Hi, no i didn't  installed the update on W7 or W8 Computer , but i will try it an i will make a Feedback to you .

> no i didn't installed the update on W7 or W8 Computer , but i will try it an i will make a Feedback to you

Did you find time for testing?

Winfried
